column1: #Text=Sr1-xNaxRuO3 (x = 0.00, 0.05, 0.10) perovskites were synthesized in polycrystalline form by a wet-chemistry procedure to obtain very reactive precursors and reduce the final synthesis temperature.

#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of Sr (NO3)2 (Sigma Aldrich 99.99% trace metals basis), Na2CO3 anhydrous (Sigma Aldrich 99.999% trace metals basis), and RuO2 (Sigma Aldrich 99.9% trace metals basis) were dissolved in 150 mL of 0.1M citric acid (Sigma Aldrich assay ≥ 99.5%) and 20 mL of nitric acid (Panreac 65%), to ensure complete dissolution of the starting materials.
#Text=We added 5% excess of Na2CO3 to compensate the possible partial evaporation at high temperatures.
#Text=The mixture was stirred at ~120 °C until complete evaporation, leading to the formation of resins containing a homogeneous distribution of the metal cations.
#Text=The resins were dried afterwards at 500 ° C for 12 h, to eliminate organic material and nitrates.
#Text=Finally, the samples were subjected to different temperatures in air during 12 h: 800 °C for x = 0.00, 900 °C for x = 0.05 and 1000 °C for x = 0.10.
#Text=If SrRuO3 is calcined at higher temperatures, other competitive phases appear.
